dxf2svg.svg
Class SvgCollection

java.lang.Object
  dxf2svg.svg.SvgElement
      dxf2svg.svg.SvgCollection
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
SvgEntityDeclaration, SvgGroup, SvgHatchPattern, SvgSymbol
public abstract class SvgCollection
extends SvgElement

This class is the base class for all collections of SvgObjects. These come in three types: <pattern>, <g> and <symbol> but you are not limited to those three. Collections may contain a mixture of SvgReferences and SvgObjects.

Version:
1.11 - March 1, 2005
Author:
Andrew Nisbet
See Also:
SvgSymbol, SvgGroup, SvgLayerGroup

addElements

public void addElements(java.lang.Object[] srs)
This allows a calling object to add an array of SvgReferences to the collection. The ordering of the objects in the array will be preserved.

Parameters:

Returns:
Vector reference to the internal collection of SvgObjects.

size

public int size()
This method will return the number of elements in the collection, much like the size() method of a java lang collection.

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
This method is for testing whether there are elements in the collection. This prevents empty collections from being output to the final SVG file. BlockProcessor takes advantage of this behaviour if it doesn't find any meaningful dxf group pairs in a block's entities.

Returns:
Boolean True, the collection is empty; false, the collection contains 1 or more elements.

searchContent

public int searchContent(java.util.Vector v,
                         java.util.regex.Pattern p)
This method will perform searches within the textual content of the Svg file.

This method works by searching for content within a collection with the help of Pattern. This pattern is a regular expression as described in Pattern's documentation.

Searches are performed recursively on SvgText objects, that is if the collection contains collections, they too will be searched.

Returns the number of patterns matched.

The Vector v is where you will find your matches if any. If there was no content that matched the argument pattern the Vector will remain unchanged. If a match was found, any content the Vector may have held will be replaced with matched content. If the Vector is null then it is assumed that the user wants to just test for the presents of content described by the Pattern and no matches are returned.

The Pattern argument is the compiled regular expression that you use as the basis of your search.

searchForElements

public int searchForElements(java.util.Vector v,
                             java.util.regex.Pattern p)
This method will perform searches within the textual content of the Svg file and return references to all the elements found.

This method works by searching for content within a collection with the help of Pattern. This pattern is a regular expression as described in Pattern's documentation.

Searches are performed recursively on SvgText objects, that is if the collection contains collections, they too will be searched.

Returns the number of patterns matched.

The Vector v is where you will find your matches if any. If there was no content that matched the argument pattern the Vector will remain unchanged. If a match was found, any content the Vector may have held will be replaced with matched content. If the Vector is null then it is assumed that the user wants to just test for the presents of content described by the Pattern and no matches are returned.

The Pattern argument is the compiled regular expression that you use as the basis of your search.

searchContent

protected java.lang.Integer searchContent(java.util.Vector v,
                                          java.util.regex.Pattern p,
                                          java.lang.Object o,
                                          java.lang.Integer prevMatchCount,
                                          boolean isElementSearch)
Recursive search method. This method is not meant to be called by client objects, but acts a the recursive version of the searchContent(java.util.Vector, java.util.regex.Pattern) method.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Outputs a formatted String, collection of SvgObjects.
